discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Examining the prefetch directory helps determine the applications that have been run on a system

questions.question_text: An investigator is conducting a forensic analysis on a Windows machine suspected of accessing the Dark Web. The investigator has found Tor browser artifacts, but the Tor browser has been uninstalled. Which of the following steps should the investigator take next to obtain more information on the user's activities?

choices.B: Check the prefetch files using a tool such as WinPrefetchView
choices.C: Look for the 'State' file in the \Tor Browser\Browser\TorBrowser\Data\Tor\ directory
choices.A: Use the netstat -ano command to check the active network connections
choices.D: Examine the registry key: HKEY_USERS\\SOFTWARE\Mozilla\Firefox\Launcher for path information

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
They must create the image first before starting to analyse the data!!

Selected Answer: A
On an unlocked and unrooted Android device, the investigator can perform logical acquisition by connecting the device to the forensic workstation via USB and running the adb pull command to acquire data.

choices.C: Generate an image of the firmware -> Retrieve database files using the adb pull command -> Parse database files -> Conduct data analysis
choices.B: Parse database files -> Retrieve database files using the adb pull command -> Generate an image of the firmware -> Conduct data analysis
choices.A: Retrieve database files using the adb pull command -> Generate an image of the firmware -> Parse database files -> Conduct data analysis
choices.D: Retrieve database files using the adb pull command -> Parse database files -> Generate an image of the firmware -> Conduct data analysis

questions.question_text: A forensic investigator has collected a compromised Amazon Echo Dot and a smartphone from a crime scene. The Alexa app on the smartphone is synced with the Echo Dot. To begin investigating these devices, the investigator needs to obtain certain artifacts. In this scenario, which of the following sequence of steps should the investigator follow to acquire the necessary artifacts for a client-based analysis?

choices.A: Deploy Autoruns for Windows to check if the suspicious service is configured to run at system bootup
choices.D: Utilize the Windows Service Manager to create an identical service and study its behavior
choices.C: Use SrvMan to stop the suspicious service and analyze its impact on the system
choices.B: Inspect the startup folder for the presence of the suspicious service using command prompt commands

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/autoruns

Autoruns provides a comprehensive view of all auto-starting locations in Windows, including services, drivers, startup items, scheduled tasks, and more.

allows investigators to identify and verify suspicious services without executing or altering them, which is critical when analyzing potentially harmful malware.

In this case, since the service mimics a legitimate one and runs with SYSTEM-level privileges, running it or stopping it directly could be risky (e.g., might trigger a payload).

Autoruns operates passively, meaning it doesn't modify system behavior but offers detailed insight, including the path, publisher, and command-line arguments of the serviceâ€”helpful for determining if it's malicious or masquerading.

It's especially effective in identifying persistence mechanisms, which is essential in malware investigations.
---
Please UPVOTE!

Selected Answer: A
Autoruns utility has the most comprehensive knowledge of auto-starting locations of any startup monitor, and shows what programs are configured to run during system bootup or login, and when various built-in Windows applications such as Internet Explorer, Explorer, and media players are started.

questions.question_text: An investigator is studying a suspicious Windows service discovered on a corporate system that seems to be associated with malware. The service has a name similar to a genuine Windows service, runs as a SYSTEM account, and exhibits potentially harmful behavior. Which tool and method should the investigator use to study the service's behavior without allowing it to inflict more damage?

choices.B: Use DriverView utility to list all device drivers currently loaded on the system and check their details such as load address, description, version, product name, and the company that created the driver
choices.C: Use the FCIV utility to generate and verify hash values of files using MD5 or SHA-1 algorithms
choices.A: Use Tripwire Enterprise to monitor servers, desktops, directory servers, hypervisors, databases, middleware applications, and network devices
choices.D: Utilize PA File Sight to track who is deleting, moving, or reading files: detect users copying files: and optionally block access

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
DriverView utility displays a list of all device drivers currently loaded on the system. For each driver in the list, additional information, such as the load address of the driver, description, version, product name, and the company that created the driver, is displayed.

questions.question_text: In a recent cyber-attack, a malicious driver was installed on a Windows system. The investigator in charge is now tasked with analyzing the system behavior to identify and verify the authenticity of the suspicious device driver. Which of the following approaches should the investigator use to complete this task efficiently?

An investigator analyzes event logs from a Windows 10 system for a suspected security breach. The investigator needs to find the logs related to account management events. A peculiar set of actions observed is an account creation followed by a change in the account within a short span of time. Which Event IDs should the investigator look for in the logs?
